originalText.text:
very convenient parking lot if you stay in Conrad. It’s within walking distance and you will get a discount on the parking fee if you get a stamp of the hotel.
The parking staff will park the car and take it out for you.
However, it’s a little pricey. But I guess it’s a normal price for NYC.
Recommended for those travel to NY and stay in Conrad.

originalText.text: Normally the workers are great. But this night they had a person working the system for thier 2nd night of employment. He definitely was not trained Ed on monthly membership users. Waited almost 20 minutes for him to clear me from the system and not to mention the attendant brought me the wrong vehicle. Good thing I had my remote start on me so he was able to get the correct vehicle the 2nd time.

originalText.text:
When we came to get our car out of the garage, they drove our car out and forgot to leave the remote start key fob in the car. The only reason why the car was still running was because we had an extra key in our bag however, the original key that was left in the car when we parked, was no where in sight. We searched the entire car and even left without any key fob inside and the car would not start, indicating that they did not leave our key in the car.

While the car was parked in the garage, we came back at least 3 times to get things from the car and specifically saw the the employees unlocking the car with the key fob from the booth. We made a claim for damages however the manager did not accept liability because they claim they never take the key out of push to start cars even though as stated earlier, we saw them unlock the car from the booth multiple times.

When we called the manager back an hour later after realizing the original key was not in the car, he repeatedly said “we do not have the key” without even asking any other employees. He even started laughing at one point when I asked him to ask his employees and just said that they are busy at the moment. I left them my number and never even received a call back letting us know if any other employees forgot to leave the key when they drove our car out.

We paid $130 for just over 24 hours and for them to forget to leave a $250 key fob back in our car is irresponsible, unprofessional, and just sloppy. I would not recommend this place as the employees were not helpful and the ones that caused this problem. You might as well use the Icon parking right across the street because this experience was extremely stressful.

originalText.text: I have no complaints been parking there for almost 6 months now. The staff is nice and reliable. I left my wallet in my glove compartment by mistake with cash inside of it. When I returned it was still there.  I'm a emergency medical technician (EMT) and they also offer Covid-19 discount for first responders, which is amazing. They are being supportive of the first responders and health care professionals in the front lines. THANK YOU ICON PARKING.

originalText.text: The parking garage is fine. Upon arriving someone created us and moved us along quickly. The check in and out process is all phone number and QR code driven, so that's cool. My only complaint is that it's very expensive.
